conclusion: The problem involves determining the minimum safe distance between a motorcycle and a car to prevent collision after both start braking simultaneously.
The velocity-time graph shows the motorcycle starts at 4 m/s and decelerates to 0 m/s over 8 seconds.
The motorcycle takes 8 seconds to come to a complete stop, calculated using the formula v = u + at.
The distance traveled by the motorcycle during braking is 16 meters, calculated using the formula s = ut + 0.5at².
The car takes 12 seconds to come to a complete stop, calculated using the equation v = 3 - 0.25t.
The distance traveled by the car during braking is 18 meters, calculated using the formula s = ut + 0.5at².
The minimum safe distance between the two vehicles is 3.5 meters, calculated as the difference in braking distances plus the initial distance.
